wikipedia_page.main: Henry James Lloyd (2 February 1794 – 3 September 1853) was an English amateur cricketer who played first-class cricket from 1815 to 1830.Lloyd was born at Marylebone, London. Mainly associated with Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC), he made 34 known appearances in first-class matches.  He played for several predominantly amateur teams including the Gentlemen in the Gentlemen v Players series. He died at Brighton, Sussex.

link_mentions.page: List of people with surname Lloyd

response: Charles Spencer Lloyd (11 August 1789 – 20 June 1876) was an English first-class cricketer active 1819 to 1850 who played for Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC). He was born in Leaton Knolls, Shropshire and died in Leatherhead. Henry J. Lloyd was his brother.Charles Lloyd at CricketArchive
